message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.CV 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with natural language processing tasks such as word embedding and topic modeling. It also utilizes a generative model to combine these two techniques. 

It could also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning) as it involves the use of a variational inference method to learn the topic embeddings and topic mixing proportions. 

cs.IR (Information Retrieval) is another possible sub-category as the paper deals with document classification tasks. 

cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is also a likely sub-category as the paper involves the use of machine learning techniques to represent documents in a low-dimensional continuous space. 

Finally, cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) is a possible sub-category as the paper deals with the representation of documents in a continuous space, which is a technique commonly used in computer vision tasks such as image embedding.
